data.title: Bhalaji Natarajan on LinkedIn: Tie up with university tun Hussein onn Malaysia
data.meta_description: Tie up with university tun Hussein onn Malaysia
data.text:
Call for Ideas for LiFE! UGC requests all HEIs to encourage their students, faculty and research scholars to participate in the 'Call on Ideas for LiFE' initiative. Join the initiative and contribute to a sustainable and environment-friendly lifestyle. Read the UGC letter to know more: https://lnkd.in/gyQabJyi

🚀 𝘾𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝘼𝙡𝙡 𝙀𝙖𝙧𝙡𝙮-𝙎𝙩𝙖𝙜𝙚 𝙁𝙤𝙪𝙣𝙙𝙚𝙧𝙨! 🚀 At Titan Capital, we are more than just investors; we are committed partners from day 0. We empower founders to build global businesses and support category creators with seed funding right from the start. If you have a groundbreaking idea and the passion to create something extraordinary, we want to hear from you. Apply now by filling out the form link attached in the comments below and take the first step towards turning your vision into reality. Let’s build the future together. #StartupFunding #EarlyStageStartups #TitanCapital #VentureCapital #Entrepreneurship

We are happy to share that we have successfully completed the Library Automation Software for our institution's Central Library. We want to show our deepest gratitude to our principal, Bhalaji Natarajan sir, for providing us with this incredible opportunity and for his invaluable support. Thank you, sir! A huge shoutout to my amazing teammates: Roshan N, Akshay G, Selvamari Kannan S, Vijay K, Godwin Judah J, Akhil T V, Manisha R Monica A, Mrithunjaya D. R. It was the best team effort, and this achievement wouldn't have been possible without each of them. Working with them has been a memorable and wonderful experience. A special mention and heartfelt thanks to our guide, Deepak Suresh Kumar Rajasekaran sir, for his guidance, encouragement, and help in overcoming every challenge throughout this project. Words cannot express our gratitude for your support and mentorship, sir. Thank you all for making this project a remarkable success!

As reported in The Times Of India, Indian Institute of Technology, Madras is offering a 4-month certificate course in 'Innovation and Entrepreneurship - A Multi-disciplinary Approach.' This course, available in hybrid mode on the NPTEL IIT Madras platform, connects science, engineering, humanities, and management. It provides an in-depth exploration of essential start-up concepts and is open to final-year students from any background. 🗓️ Course Start Date: July 30 🔔 Last Registration Date: July 29 🔗 Register Here: https://lnkd.in/gzW7wy_j Led by Prof T Pradeep, Department of Chemistry, Prof. Prabhu Rajagopal, Innovation and Entrepreneurship, and Prof A. Thillai Rajan, Department of Management Studies and Head, Centre for Research on Start-Ups, the course fosters an appreciation for turning ideas into products. Students will receive a certificate upon completion, and institutions may integrate this course into their academic programs. The program includes visits to research parks, innovation hubs, and start-ups. Last year, students visited the Centre for Innovation, IIT Madras Research Park, IIT Madras Incubation Cell (IITMIC), and various start-ups. Read here: https://lnkd.in/gRb4XpuV #IITMadras #Innovation #Entrepreneurship #NPTEL #HybridLearning

Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced the establishment of a Rs 1,000 crore venture capital fund to encourage the development of space technology during her Budget 2024 speech. The fund will significantly help in the expansion of the Indian space economy by five times in the next 10 years. According to the government, estimates suggest the current size of the Indian space economy is around $8.4 billion as of 2023, representing roughly 2-3% of the global space economy. #space #technology #budget2024 #government #research #Indianstartupnews
